@ piratetester

No, trial of WinRAR cannot cause that! Maybe you haven't permissions to download it, because you Logged in as User, not as Administrator, or you have Parental Control turned on or smth like that. Sometimes Anti-Viruses/ Internet Securities doesn't let you to download file, because it contains smth that AV/IS detects as a virus, trojan, spyware etc ( on TPB it's usually false-positive), but the problem is that this "WinRAR 4.01 x86 x64 +20 Licenses [CheckOutEr]" Torrent doesn't contain anything that even worst AV/IS can detect as any kind of threat, because it contains only clean WinRAR setups and pregenerated registration files, so if you're Administrator then in my opinion you have previously downloaded somewhere infected WinRAR Torrent & to protect your PC from virus your AV/IS Neuthralized that threat & Automatically added it to its reports that it doesn't let you to download the same files with the same size again (that setup files could be exactly the same size as in my Torrent). To solve this problem you have to Quaratine all objects that are in your AV/IS "Quaratine" , scan your PC for viruses, make sure that your AV/IS Status is "Protected", Clear all your Reports (that's the most important part) & Download this Torrent again! I hope it helps! :)
